Replace.Text: Simulate history in this game mode with four timelines to choose from, including era or year based timelines and start date customisation from the advanced setup menu. Compatible with all civilization and unit mods.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Civilizations and city-states exist in a state of limited autoplay off of the visible map until their start date. They receive units and bonuses based on the progress of other players and the current era when they start the game. Isolated and Colonial civilizations have special starting conditions and bonuses. The area surrounding the starting plot will be converted to the new player, causing revolts and invasions for cities nearby. Gameplay changes and mod settings are configurable from the setup menu.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]

Choose a timeline from the advanced setup menu:[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Standard: Based on the Civilopedia[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]True Start: Based on founding date of country[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Leader Start: Based on leader date[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Era Timeline: Based on starting era[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Era Start Mode: Converts any year-based timeline into era start[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Lite Mode: Only Isolated and Colonial civilizations receive start dates from the selected timeline

Western European civilizations will spawn colonies on foreign continents after discovering Cartography and advancing into every new era until the Modern Era. Colonies start with military units, workers and a Harbor. Coastal cities on foreign continents with a Harbor that is not pillaged are always loyal to the owner. Colonies will spawn on different continents depending on the player, and will select the best plot location based on scripted conditions. Includes option to create colonies for AI players only, and disable loyalty bonus from Harbors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]For Earth maps only

Barbarian camps will spawn unique units based on the continent and game era. These units are weaker versions of civilization unique units and can be viewed from the Civilopedia.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]For Earth maps only[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Not compatible with Barbarian Clans[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][COLOR_Civ6Red]Requires all DLC and Expansions![ENDCOLOR]
Advanced options are not required or recommended for every game. They should only be enabled after understanding the base mod effects.
Activate Historical Spawn Dates or Eras
Disable to turn off all HSD features and gameplay changes.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Use this option to disable the mod without changing your active mods.

Players will appear at the beginning of a new Era[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Compatible with all timelines[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Compatible with start dates input from the setup menu[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Start dates are based on the timeline option[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Converts the year into era automatically
[COLOR_Civ6Red]Disabling this option is not recommended.[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Disable to turn off all starting bonuses and spawn zones for new players.
Eureka boosts will complete a technology or civic when a player spawns.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Blue]New civilizations will be more advanced with this option enabled.[ENDCOLOR]
Receive a burst of Great Person points towards all Great People when spawning (adjusted for Game Speed)
Unique units will be included in the starting units

All Civs with HSD receive an Era Building in every city which boosts yields[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Blue]By default when this option is disabled, only Colonial Civs will receive Era Buildings.[ENDCOLOR]

Activate dynamic colony generation for western European civilizations. Colonies will spawn at the beginning of every game era starting with the Renaissance. Colonies will spawn on different continents depending on the player, and will select the best plot location based on scripted conditions. Cartography must be researched at the time of the era transition to spawn colonies. If a player researches Cartography after an era transition, the colonies that were meant to spawn that era will spawn during the next era transition. This effect is cumulative, so multiple eras worth of colonies can be spawned if there is available land.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Blue]Custom civilizations can be added to this list in the mod files.[ENDCOLOR]
Colonization Mode will include the human player.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Blue]If this option is disabled, only AI players will receive colonies.[ENDCOLOR]
Cities in the Spawn Zone will not revolt. New players can still Declare War if the Spawn Zone is occupied.

If a spawn zone is occupied and a new starting plot is chosen, cities will revolt around the new starting plot instead of the original spawn zone.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Red]Not recommended for Earth maps.[ENDCOLOR]

+1 Era Score per turn is earned from the start of the game for players waiting to spawn. This will generate an excessive amount of Era Score and guarantee a Golden Age for any player spawning after the Ancient Era.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Blue]By default when this option is disabled, Era Score is not earned until the first Civilization enters the Classical Era (measured by tech or civic progress). Depending on when this happens, there may not be enough Era Score to prevent a Dark Age during the first era transition for all players waiting to spawn.[ENDCOLOR]

Starting units for new players will be one era behind the current Game Era.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Blue]By default when this option is disabled, the advancement of starting units is equal to the current Game Era.[ENDCOLOR]

Isolated and Colonial players or city-states will receive start dates. All others start on turn 1 like a normal game[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Compatible with all timelines[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Compatible with Era mode[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Starting dates for Isolated and Colonial players are based on the selected timeline option

Cities in the spawn zone for a new player will be directly converted to that player. Always converts the capital if the starting plot is owned by another player. Surrounding cities are converted under the following conditions:[NEWLINE]- Not an original capital[NEWLINE]- Not the owner's last city[NEWLINE]- No established Governor in city[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When this option is disabled, cities in the spawn zone will convert to the Free Cities faction according to the same conditions, but not directly to the new player.
Choose a type of spawn zone. This will determine which cities are included in the spawn zone. Use the Convert Cities option above to change what happens to cities in the spawn zone.
Try to convert one city per player within the spawn zone (excluding the capital). The entire spawn zone is scanned for possible cities, and obstacles are ignored.
Try to convert every city within the spawn zone that is not separated by mountains or water. The city plot must have a reachable path entirely within the spawn zone to be converted.
Try to convert every city within the spawn zone. Obstacles are ignored.
Coastal cities owned by players with a Harbor or unique replacement will always remain loyal.
Gran Colombia Comandante unique units will spawn in the Industrial Era (all previous Era units will spawn at once)

Starting era for Gran Colombia's Comandante General to appear. This option should match their start date.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]1 = Classical (default)[NEWLINE]2 = Medieval[NEWLINE]3 = Renaissance[NEWLINE]4 = Industrial[NEWLINE]5 = Modern[NEWLINE]6 = Atomic[NEWLINE]7 = Information[NEWLINE]

Edit start dates from the selected timeline. Dates must be entered in number format. Use negative numbers for BC and positive for AD. This will override all other dates visible in the setup menu or timeline files. Start dates visible under player items in the setup menu will not reflect the dates entered here. Start dates entered here will not be visible in-game as a player trait.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Use this option to enter start dates for modded civilizations or leaders that are missing from the timeline[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]When the Era Start timeline is selected, enter starting dates as single digits representing the index of the era: 0, 1, 2 etc. where 0 = Ancient, 1 = Classical, 2 = Medieval, and so on.
Based on a mixture of historical realism and gameplay balance
Based on the national founding dates for countries
Based on the birth date of the Leader.
Start dates are defined by era.

Set the range surrounding the starting plot to be searched for a suitable location for a new city, if the spawn zone is occupied.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If a new city cannot be built within this range, the new player will spawn on the nearest unoccupied plot to the starting plot.
Geographically dependant barbarian camps with unique units linked to the continent.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Red]Requires all DLC and Expansions![ENDCOLOR]
Activate the PeacefulSpawns list. Players in this list will not declare war when spawning.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Blue]Define the players in this list from the file IsolatedCivs.sql[ENDCOLOR]

Activate the RestrictedSpawns list. Players in this list will only try to convert their capital city when spawning.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Blue]Define the players in this list from the file IsolatedCivs.sql[ENDCOLOR]

Activate the UniqueSpawnZones list. Players in this list will use scripted spawn zone conditions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_Civ6Blue]Define the players in this list from the file IsolatedCivs.sql. Define the conditions for a unique spawn zone in ScriptHSD.lua in function GetUniqueSpawnZone()[ENDCOLOR]
Cities with established governors can be converted in the spawn zone. When this option is disabled, cities with an established governor will not be converted.
Any city can be converted in a spawn zone, including capitals, city-states and a player's final city. Use at your own risk!
Choose from dynamically spawning units or a predefined list.
Spawn units based on tech or civic progress and enabled mods. This option supports any mod that adds units, and unique units are always available.
Spawn units based on a predefined list for each player based on the current era. Units will spawn dynamically if the predefined unit is missing from the game due to mod changes.
All Civilizations use Historical Spawn Dates
Only Colonial and Isolated Civs use Historical Spawn Dates
